decks.notes: The main idea behind this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal while utilizing Nin, the Pain Artist's ability to draw cards and deal damage. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells such as Counterspell, Cryptic Command, and Mana Leak, as well as removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods. The deck also features cards like Snapcaster Mage and Dig Through Time to provide card advantage and flexibility in decision-making. By maintaining control of the game and utilizing Nin's abilities effectively, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory in a one-on-one match.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a variety of counterspells, board wipes, and extra turn spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building card advantage and controlling the board. By utilizing key cards like Narset, Enlightened Master and other Planeswalkers such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Chandra, Flamecaller, the deck aims to generate value and out-value the opponent over time. With a mix of reactive spells like Counterspell and disruption like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to manipulate the game state in its favor, ultimately leading to a win through attrition and card advantage.

The deck revolves around utilizing Doran, the Siege Tower's ability to make creatures deal combat damage based on their toughness rather than power. This means that the deck focuses on including creatures with high toughness and powerful abilities to take advantage of Doran's effect. In addition to creatures, the deck includes a range of removal spells, disruption, and powerful equipment to control the board and deal damage efficiently. With a strong mana base and a variety of powerful cards like Swords to Plowshares, Tarmogoyf, and Vindicate, the deck aims to establish board presence, control the game, and beat down opponents quickly with its aggro strategy.

This deck revolves around using Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to maintain control over the game. The key concept is to constantly disrupt the opponent's plans and prevent them from developing their board state through a myriad of counterspells, removal spells, and bounce effects. The deck also includes various card draw spells to ensure a steady stream of resources, as well as a selection of planeswalkers and creatures to provide additional value and win conditions. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the control strategy, with utility lands to further enhance the deck's ability to control the battlefield. Overall, the goal is to outmaneuver and outlast opponents through careful decision-making and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and powerful equipment to apply pressure on the opponent and control the game. By using Jenara, Asura of War as the commander, the deck can easily close out games with her ability to grow in power. The deck includes a mix of mana acceleration, disruptive creatures, card draw, and versatile counterspells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence. With cards like Umezawa's Jitte, Sword of Feast and Famine, and Stoneforge Mystic, the deck can quickly take over the game with powerful equipment and combat tricks. The goal is to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's plans to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing mana dorks and mana ramp spells to quickly generate mana and create a large board presence. With Prossh, Skyraider of Kher as the commander, the goal is to assemble the Combo pieces such as Earthcraft and Goblin Bombardment to create infinite creature tokens and deal damage to opponents. The deck includes powerful combo pieces like Purphoros, God of the Forge and Craterhoof Behemoth to quickly close out the game. Additionally, the deck includes a wide range of removal, disruption, and tutors to control the board and find the necessary combo pieces. The strategy revolves around efficiently ramping mana, assembling the combo, and overwhelming opponents with a powerful board presence.

This deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion and powerful combo pieces to control the game and ultimately win through a powerful combo finish. Sidisi, Undead Vizier serves as both a tutor and a sacrifice outlet, allowing the deck to consistently find and play key combo pieces like Necrotic Ooze, Phyrexian Devourer, and Triskelion. The deck also includes a variety of efficient removal spells and disruption to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. With cards like Animate Dead, Dance of the Dead, and Reanimate, the deck can bring back key creatures from the graveyard to continue its combo plan. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces, control the game, and win through a decisive combo finish.

This Sidisi, Undead Vizier deck focuses on utilizing a combination of powerful reanimation spells, tutors, and removal to quickly assemble combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to generate a high amount of mana through artifacts and land ramp, while also controlling the board with a variety of targeted discard and removal spells. With strong combo finishers like Necrotic Ooze and Griselbrand, the deck can quickly close out games once its engine is set up. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Liliana of the Veil provide additional versatility and control options. Ultimately, the key strategy of this deck is to efficiently assemble combos and disrupt opponents' game plans to secure victory.
